pageContext.claim: “Now, the easy solution is for me to call a national emergency. I could do that very quickly. I have the absolute right to do it but I'm not going to do it so fast, because this is something Congress should do and we're waiting for the Democrats to vote.”
pageContext.analysis: Legal experts have said that it is uncertain whether a president could declare a national emergency under these circumstances -- and it is possible his action would be tied up in the courts for months, if not years.
